newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ANZ cuts Australian credit card rates.
newsitem.headline: ANZ cuts Australian credit card rates.

text.p: Australia and New Zealand Banking Group Ltd (ANZ) said on Monday it would cut credit card interest rates by 0.5 percentage points from September 15.
The rate on ANZ's Free Days MasterCard, Visa Classic and Bankcard would be cut to 15.45 percent from 15.95 percent. The rate on ANZ's Low Interest Mastercard would be cut to 12.45 percent from 12.95.
Rates on Gold cards would be cut to 15.25 percent from 15.75 percent.
The bank said interest on its ANZ Visa Standby card, 14.95 percent, and on its co-branded cards, 16.35 percent, would remain unchanged.

The reduction in ANZ's credit card rates follow the Reserve Bank of Australia's 0.5 percentage point cut in official cash rates on July 30 and National Australia Bank's (NAB) move to lower its credit card rates on Friday.
